main event: Four civilians reported seeing a V-formation of 7 to 9 light-revolving objects over Bethesda, Maryland, at 0130 EST on 18 April 1952.
interesting points: The included angle of the formation or 'V' was estimated to be 40 degrees.
There were slight changes in the speed and three to five craft changed to be orange-yellow, circular, and to occupy 15 percent of the total length of the formation.
The formation, or object, was first sighted at an elevation of about 60 degrees in the south and disappeared behind some trees at 60 degrees in the north.
The total time of observation was about four to eight seconds and there was no sound.

All four observers were interrogated and their accounts of the incident were similar. They stated that they had not seen the Life Magazine article describing the Lubbock incident prior to the sighting.
